name: Samosa
description: A popular fried or baked pastry with a savory filling, such as spiced potatoes, onions, and peas. It is a beloved snack throughout India.
instructions: To make the dough, combine flour, salt, and oil in a bowl. Rub the oil into the flour until it resembles breadcrumbs. Gradually add cold water and knead until a firm dough forms. Cover and let rest for 15 minutes.

For the filling, heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add ginger-garlic paste and saute for 30 seconds. Add the mashed potatoes, green peas, and all the spices. Mix well and cook for 5 minutes. Let the filling cool completely.
Divide the dough into 8 equal parts. Roll each part into an oval shape. Cut the oval in half to get two semicircles.
Take one semicircle, moisten the straight edge with water, and fold it into a cone. Fill the cone with the potato mixture and seal the top edge by pinching it closed.

Heat oil in a deep pan to 325°F (160°C). Gently place the samosas in the hot oil and fry in batches. Fry for 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until they are golden brown and crispy. Serve hot with chutney.

name: Butter Chicken
description: A rich and creamy curry made with marinated chicken, a velvety tomato-based sauce, and plenty of butter and cream. A crowd-pleasing dish.
ingredients: 1.5 lbs boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs, cubed
instructions: In a bowl, combine all the chicken marinade ingredients. Add the chicken and mix well. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.

Heat vegetable oil and 1 tbsp butter in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the chicken from the pot and set it aside.
In the same pot, add the remaining butter and chopped onion. Saute until the onion is soft and translucent. Add the ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Stir in the tomato puree, sugar, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Return the chicken to the pot. Stir in the heavy cream and cilantro. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld. Serve hot with naan bread or rice.

name: Chana Masala
description: A flavorful and hearty vegetarian dish of chickpeas simmered in a spiced tomato-onion gravy. A staple of Indian comfort food.
ingredients: 1 (15 oz) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add the chopped onion and saute until golden brown.

Stir in the ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute until fragrant. Add the tomato puree, turmeric, coriander, and red chili powder. Cook, stirring, until the oil separates from the masala, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the rinsed chickpeas and chana masala powder. Mix well to coat the chickpeas with the spices. Add the water and salt, and bring to a simmer.
Reduce the heat, cover the pan, and cook for 15-20 minutes, allowing the flavors to deepen. Mash a few chickpeas with the back of a spoon to thicken the gravy.
Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving. Serve hot with rice, roti, or naan.

name: Rogan Josh
description: Aromatic and tender lamb curry from Kashmir, known for its vibrant red color and mild, rich gravy. The color comes from dried red chilies, not heat.
instructions: Heat oil and ghee in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Brown the lamb in batches and set it aside.
In the same pot, add the bay leaves, cinnamon stick, cardamom, and cloves. Cook for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add the chopped onion and saute until golden brown.
Add the ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute. Reduce heat to low. Stir in the Kashmiri red chili powder, coriander, and garam masala. Cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
Slowly whisk in the yogurt, a tablespoon at a time, to prevent curdling. Stir continuously until the yogurt is fully incorporated into the masala.
Return the lamb to the pot. Add the water or broth and salt. Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 1-1.5 hours, or until the lamb is tender.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with naan bread or rice.
